visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts column chart with the title 'The stacklabels are moved 50px to the left'. The chart should have two data series with monthly data for a year. The x-axis should display the months, and the y-axis should have stack labels enabled and moved 50px to the left. The chart should use custom colors and have specific styling for labels, axes, and titles.

title.text: The stacklabels are moved 50px to the left

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a column chart with specific customizations. The chart type is set to 'column', and it includes a title styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 18px. The x-axis displays month categories with labels styled in a lighter gray color and a font size of 14px. The y-axis has stack labels enabled, styled in black with a font size of 12px, and moved 50px to the left. The y-axis title is styled similarly to the x-axis labels, and the y-axis labels are also styled in a lighter gray color. The plot options for the column chart include stacking and padding configurations. The data series includes two series with monthly data, each assigned a custom color. The legend is enabled and styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The chart background is set to a light gray color, and margins are adjusted for better visibility.
